document_metadata.title: Tyler Fisk - Brand Voice Megadoc Analysis
document_metadata.analysis_focus: Sentence structure patterns and linguistic characteristics

dominant_patterns: Conversational fragments with high frequency of informal connectors
Mix of short, punchy sentences with longer, complex explanations
Frequent use of parenthetical asides and clarifications
Rhetorical questions used for engagement and pacing
Repetition of key phrases for emphasis and memorability

examples: All right.
Yeah, no worries.
That's awesome.
I love it.
Let's go.
simple_sentences.pattern_notes: Often used as standalone utterances in live speech; creates rhythm and engagement

examples: So we're going to be using a tool called Typing Mind, and you will need your own Typing Mind account.
I'm excited for this, and we have been working since January of this year to like build, improve, change with the updates from the different platforms.
It's not something that I would actually go deploy automations in, and it's not that at all.
compound_sentences.pattern_notes: Frequently connected with 'and' rather than other conjunctions; creates flowing, additive structure

examples: Like, TypingMind, you could think of this, if y'all have ever been in OpenAI's Playground or Google's AI Studio, Anthropics, like Workbench, like their whole backend, where you can go in and work in it from an API layer, you have all the switches and dials, all the things.
Because as a business grows, your role generally changes as a founder, and you're not able to do that same amount of stuff.
What happens now in this system that we've built is that the growers team will have a one hour, roughly one hour call with a client, and that transcript from that call is one of the inputs in here.
complex_sentences.subordination_patterns: Heavy use of embedded clauses; multiple levels of nesting

examples: So close.
No worries.
Yeah, like, two things.
Not kindergarten anymore, people.
Just know that it's hard.
fragmented_sentences.function: Emphasis, conversational authenticity, pacing in live speech
fragmented_sentences.context: Predominantly in live session; creates informal, accessible tone

independent_clauses.characteristic_structure: Often short and declarative; frequently used as sentence openers
examples: I'm excited for this.
We have been working since January.
That's the way that it is.
You're going to learn so much.
When you get this, and when you go out in the real world
As you're thinking through this more and building it out
Once you've hit that
If you come from, like, a very detailed, like, expect the same output every single time
If you're not saying that, drop that into the chat
If you haven't done your week four project
Because this is what we're talking about here is how to scale your business with AI
Because it's what I'm personally diving into myself much more
Because we have all this training data for you to go in and emulate that
That would take subject matter experts, domain experts in their fields that, you know, took decades
Where you can go in and build out any kinds of assistants and agents
That is something that you're going to have to evaluate

prepositional_phrases.characteristic_usage: Often stacked or chained; used for specificity and context
examples: In the same way with that real estate organization
At the very end of that
In the weeds on evals as like a production level eval
